Invasion by Alauddin Khilji

Ramachandra was the last great ruler of the Yadava dynasty. In 1296 CE, Alauddin Khilji launched a surprise attack on Devagiri. Ramachandra had to surrender and pay a heavy ransom. This was the first Muslim invasion of South India.

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Rai Rayan

Later, in 1307, Malik Kafur attacked again. Ramachandra was taken to Delhi, where Alauddin treated him with respect and bestowed upon him the title of 'Rai Rayan'. He later assisted Khilji in his southern campaigns. The great Marathi saint Dnyaneshwar was his contemporary.
